result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin T. Bruch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: --to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--the Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapon

--Mr. Bruch is not to communicate with his grandparents (Doris Bruch or Stanley Bruch) in or under any circumstances
 
--the Defendant shall not have any contact with Doris Bruch or Stanley Bruch

--the Defendant shall not engage in any acts or threats of violence

--the Defendant shall not be present at Doris and Stanley Bruch's residence

--the Defendant shall undergo any psychological/ psychiatric evaluation as directed by the Department of Corrections and follow through with any recommended treatment/ therapy/ counseling

--the Defendant shall engage in any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent

-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: JEFFERSON COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPT

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: --the Court indicates that costs [any unpaid court financial obligations] are to be paid within sixty days, or else Mr. Bruch needs to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office within that time period; non-payment will result in 30 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.

--serve 5 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Order Re: Payment Plan and Failure to Pay Commitment  THE COURT ORDERS THAT:  Upon deposit of $200 and current address information, the Defendant shall be released from custody, on the above mentioned case(s).  The Defendant shall pay the remaining balance, plus Interest and a $15 Payment Plan Fee, at the rate of $25/mo., commencing 10/01/2021.  25% Annual Increase of monthly payments shall be implemented. 
The Civil Judgment and referral to the WI DOR, if applicable, shall remain.  Any failure to comply with this payment order shall result in the re-imposition of the failure to pay sentence without further notice of hearing. cc:def/Jeso

Proposed Order Re: Payment Plan and Failure to Pay Commitment
Letter from Defendant re payment plan
per JCSD Defendant is serving the time // Duplicate Original Warrant original warrant returned from JCSD
Payment restart in 03/15/2019.  Case 18CM359 added - payment plan fee assessed.  Increase to $50.00/month 01/15/2020 - 25% annual increase each year thereafter. New summary mailed.

[MK] cases #18CM359, #16CM39, #17CM459 called at 3:43pm.  
Defendant Dustin T. Bruch in court with Attorney Joel R Witt.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
____________
In Case #18CM359: Initial Appearance is held:. 
---Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
---The Defense stands mute; pleas of  "not guilty" are entered by the Court; speedy trial is waived by the Defense.

___________
In Case #16CM39 the Court addresses the stayed-Commitment Order: 
---The Court continues the stay of the Commitment, granting Mr. Bruch an additional thirty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a new payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. The same alternate sentence applies.

___________
In Case #17CM459 Sentencing arguments are given. The Court sentences Mr. Bruch to:
--serve 25 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for work and for home-care.  There is not to be any use of electronic monitoring for service of this jail term. This jail sentence is to commence on or before October 29, 2018 at 7:00pm 
--days credit is given for time already served:  one day 
--payment of costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court allows Mr. Bruch 30 days to either pay the amount or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 20 days in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges, concurrent 
recess 3:96pm 


NEXT:  in Case #18CM359 only-- (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/24/18 at 9:00am,    (2)  Status Conference on 11/6/18 at 9:30am
Return on warrant on September 20, 2018 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Dustin T. Bruch
Current: 408 S. Jackson St, Janesville, WI 53548 United States  (Effective: 09-13-2018)
Prior: 601 N Main St, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

[MA]Case 17CM459 called at 3:18pm 
Defendant Dustin T. Bruch in court with Attorney Joel R Witt.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. J. Witt indicates that Defense is prepared to enter a plea on Case 17CM459

At the request of Atty Witt, The Court lifts the warrant in case 16CM39, this is to be dealt with on the same date as sentencing for case 17CM459

The Court reschedules the Initial Apperance in 18CM359 to the same date as the sentencing for case 17CM459.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " GUILTY " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

recess: 3:28pm
NEXT: Sentencing(17CM459)/Hearing on Commitment Warrant(16CM39)/Initial Appearance (18CM359) on 9/20/18 at 2:30pm

[MK] case called at 2:48pm. 
Defendant Dustin T. Bruch in court, in custody, with Attorney Teri Strohschein.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.
One of the victims is present in the courtroom. She responds to inquiries of the Court. 

The Court sentences Mr. Bruch to:
--serve 5 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith
--67 days credit for time already served given 
--the Court indicates that costs [any unpaid court financial obligations] are to be paid within sixty days, or else Mr. Bruch needs to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office within that time period; non-payment will result in 30 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.  
recess 2:58pm. 

NEXT:  once the court financial obligation amount is finalized, payment information is to be sent to Mr. Bruch at the Jail

Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 20, 2017 at 02:45 pm.
Court's letter to Ms. Doris Bruch

Case called at 8:53am [mo]
Defendant Dustin T. Bruch in court with attorney Whitney Hagemann.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance; submits a victim impact statement

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--Mr. Bruch is not to communicate with his grandparents (Doris Bruch or Stanley Bruch) in or under any circumstances

The Court adopts all other conditions as set for in the Criminal Case Settlement, with the exception of the DOC having authority to permit contact with Doris Bruch or Stanley Bruch; the Court does not allow this.

[which are:
--the Defendant shall undergo any psychological/ psychiatric evaluation as directed by the Department of Corrections and follow through with any recommended treatment/ therapy/ counseling
--the Defendant shall engage in any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--the Defendant shall not have any contact with Doris Bruch or Stanley Bruch
--the Defendant shall no engage in any acts or threats of violence
--the Defendant shall not be present at Doris and Stanley Bruch's residence
--the Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapon
--to pay statutory costs]


Days credit for time already served:  2 days
The Court gives prohibition under 973.049(2) and (3)
recess: 9:20am

Sent to Defendant at JCJ (1)NOH for 2/10/16 PTC (2)NOH 4/19/16 STC//Sent to JCJ

Notation on Envelope: Released, RTS

Case called at 1:33 pm [sf]
Defendant Dustin T. Bruch in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Address and DOB information verified by the Court.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Doris or Stanley Bruch
-No presence at the residence of Doris or Stanley Bruch
-Not to possess any weapons as defined by statute
-Not to possess any ammunition

Recess: 1:35 pm
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/10/16 at 9:00 am - Send Notices (2) Status Conference on 4/19/16 at 8:30 am
